title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Thunder dominate as issues plague Wolves
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western conference finals.

title: 'Juiced' after MVP win, SGA hangs 38 on Wolves
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander received his league MVP trophy and proceeded to torch the Wolves for 38 points as the Thunder routed Minnesota to take a 2-0 series lead.

title: Panthers rout Canes in ECF as Bennett scores 2
content: Sam Bennett scored two goals, and the Panthers beat the Hurricanes 5-0 to take a 2-0 lead in the Eastern Conference final.

title: Fever win in Clark's first 3-less game since '22
content: The Fever beat the Dream on Thursday night despite Caitlin Clark not making a 3 for just the second time in her career, college and pro.

title: Malone clears air: Jokic, not SGA, my MVP choice
content: Former Nuggets coach Michael Malone, who drew the ire of Denver fans when he said Thunder star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander "showed why he's the MVP" earlier this week, said he would have picked Nikola Jokic if he had a vote this season.

title: CFP approves new seeding model next season
content: The College Football Playoff is moving to a straight seeding model, giving the top four teams by seed a first-round bye, the CFP committee announced Thursday.

title: Pirates' Cherington shuts down Skenes trade talk
content: Pirates general manager Ben Cherington said Thursday that the possibility of trading ace Paul Skenes is "not part of the conversation at all."

title: Rockies off to worst 50-game start since 1895
content: The Rockies were swept in a four-game series by the Phillies to fall to 8-42 this season -- the worst 50-game start in MLB since the 1895 Louisville Colonels (7-43).

title: Ex-Brewer Ruf sues Reds for career-ending injury
content: Former Brewers player Darin Ruf is suing the Reds for damages after he suffered a career-ending injury while playing at Cincinnati's Great American Ball Park two years ago.

title: Takeaways: Hurricanes searching for answers after lopsided Game 2 loss to Panthers
content: Can the Hurricanes find a way back into the series as it moves back to Florida? Here's what you need to know.

title: Mookie Betts, Mike Trout and how we determine a generation's best player
content: Betts is climbing the all-time WAR list the same way Trout once was. We examine the two and dive into which players similarly ruled previous eras.

title: 'I'm going to get back at y'all': Inside Tyrese Haliburton's historic playoff run
content: From 26 minutes in France to a slow start to the 2024-25 NBA season, Tyrese Haliburton has found motivation from the outside.

title: KAT vs. Wolves? SGA vs. Haliburton? Ranking every possible NBA Finals
content: No matter which two teams escape the conference finals, we're headed for a never-before-seen Finals matchup.

title: The NFL's most underrated players: Why Brock Purdy, Zach Ertz and Christian Benford deserve more credit
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: How Oilers coach Kris Knoblauch became master of the midseries adjustment
content: With Edmonton down 1-0, its bench boss inspires calmness instead of panic based on past performances.

title: Inside the world of NBA 'ball boys,' the league's unsung heroes
content: Ball boys are everywhere on the court but are rarely seen or acknowledged. And yet, the NBA couldn't function without them.

title: The 12 most impactful NBA draft withdrawal decisions for college basketball
content: Milos Uzan, Alex Condon and other college hoops stars whose NBA draft decisions could materially shape 2025-26.

title: Two pro football seasons in one year? The 'unheard of' pursuit of some NFL hopefuls
content: NFL dreams have come true for UFL players, but it can come with the price of the longest season of a player's life.

title: Liverpool's 'Miracle of Istanbul' through the eyes of Benitez, Garcia and the fans
content: In 2005, Liverpool came from three goals down to win the Champions League final vs. Milan. To this day, fans and players never tire of taking about it.

title: Fore-warned: Poch tells USMNT to forget golf clubs
content: United States coach Mauricio Pochettino set some expectations ahead of the team's return to action at this summer's Concacaf Gold Cup after a disastrous fourth-place finish at the Nations League in March.

title: Conte 'regrets' Napoli absence for Serie A finale
content: Napoli manager Antonio Conte called for calm heads when his team bid to clinch the Serie A title on Friday, underlining his deep sense of responsibility to the city while expressing regret to be watching from the stands due to suspension.

title: USWNT, Current defender Cook suffers torn ACL
content: Kansas City Current and United States women's national team defender Alana Cook tore the ACL, MCL and meniscus in her left knee last week, the Current announced on Thursday.

title: Poch defends Pulisic's USMNT Gold Cup absence
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino defended the decision not to select Christian Pulisic for this summer's Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Pachuca coach Almada resigns ahead of CWC
content: Pachuca coach Guillermo Almada has submitted his resignation, which the Liga MX team has not yet accepted due to a contract buyout clause, three weeks before the Club World Cup starts.

title: United miss out as transfer guru signs PSG deal
content: PSG transfer guru Luis Campos has ended speculation over a move to Manchester United by signing a five-year contract with the French club's owners, Qatar Sports Investments (QSI), to continue his role with the Champions League finalists.

title: Modrić to leave Real Madrid after Club World Cup
content: Real Madrid legend Luka Modrić has announced he will leave the club after the end of this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Messi: Favorite goal was vs. Man Utd in UCL final
content: Inter Miami forward Lionel Messi named the header he scored against Manchester United in the 2009 Champions League final while representing Barcelona as the favorite goal of his storied career.

title: Are the NBA playoffs too physical? Have the refs actually lost control? Here's what the data says
content: The discourse -- and discord -- surrounding playoff officiating isn't new. But this year, players and coaches have wondered if the league has lost control. The NBA says its ref data is in line with past years. Who's right?

title: Will Penske cheating scandal overshadow IndyCar's crown jewel?
content: Instead of celebrating a sellout crowd, IndyCar is defusing another cheating scandal ahead of the Indy 500.

title: Norris finds peace, not pressure, in F1 title expectations
content: While the weight of expectation to win F1's title can crush some, Lando Norris is using it as motivation.

title: Can F1's rule change add action to the spectacle of Monaco?
content: The quirks that make Monaco unique also make it terrible for F1 racing. Will a new rule change fix that?

title: Everything you need to bet Monaco, Indy 500 and Coca-Cola 600
content: Betting guide to the biggest weekend in motorsports, with the Monaco Grand Prix, Indy 500, and Coca-Cola 600.

title: Roundtable: Best fight on the schedule? Next P4P king? Potential upset?
content: Andreas Hale and Nick Parkinson share their thoughts on the fights they want to see, a potential upset and more.

title: All you need to know about the newest season of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal make first move for €80m Real Madrid star Rodrygo
content: Arsenal have held the first exploratory discussions to sign Rodrygo from Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Niloufer Hospital superintendent suspended over unauthorised construction of medical store in the health facility premises
content: Health Dept official also confirmed that the construction was demolished by authorities on Friday (May 23, 2025)

content: When BRS president’s daughter said KCR was not accessible to grassroots workers, how can we expect internal democracy to thrive, he asked

title: Anantapur plans ₹350 crore annual revenue from manufacture of banana fiber products
content: The project aims to convert post-harvest banana stem residue into valuable products, it is expected to  generate substantial income for local farmers and women’s self-help groups

title: India’s foreign policy collapsed: Rahul Gandhi takes swipe at Jaishankar

title: Karnataka: Haveri gang-rape accused released on bail get grand welcome, FIR registered for unlawful assembly and rash driving

title: Guntur Commissioner directs swift desilting of outfall drains, installation of mesh to prevent waste entry
content: The Commissioner ordered officials to take up desilting of the affected outfall drains and installation of mesh to prevent solid waste from clogging the system

title: BJP MLA Kanwar Lal Meena's Assembly membership terminated after conviction in criminal case
content: According to a notification issued by the Assembly Secretariat, Meena's membership stands terminated effective from May 1

title: AIADMK MLA S.P. Velumani receives death threat; letter warns of bomb blast in Coimbatore

title: TDP’s Mahanadu 2025 to focus on NDA government’s first-year report and Rayalaseema development
content: The three-day event will begin by setting a stage for discussions on party ideology, strategies and organization on the first day

title: Reliance to invest ₹75,000 cr in North-Eastern States: Mukesh Ambani
content: Reliance has invested around ₹30,000 crore in the region in the past 40 years. In the next five years, we will more than double our investments, with our target at ₹75,000 crore, says Mukesh Ambani

title: Six killed, two seriously injured in car-truck collision
content: The accident took place near Taticharla Motu in Komarolu mandal of Prakasam district while the deceased were returning from Mahanandi

title: T.N. CM Stalin arrives in New Delhi to take part in NITI Aayog’s governing council meeting
content: Mr. Stalin’s decision to participate in this year’s NITI Aayog Governing Council meeting had triggered criticism from the Opposition parties in Tamil Nadu

title: Indian armed forces restructuring: Theatre commanders to look after ‘force application’, Service Chiefs ‘force generation’

content: “I sincerely apologise to the entire Indian Army, Sister Colonel Sofiya and all the countrymen for the words I said inadvertently and once again with folded hands I apologise.”

title: Committed to investing additional ₹50,000 crore over next 10 years in Northeastern States: Gautam Adani
content: The investments will span green energy, including smart-metres, hydro, pumped storage, power transmission, roads & highways, digital infrastructure, logistics, as well as capacity-building through skilling and vocational training centres

title: Indian food sparkles on the global stage. Trèsind Studio makes history by winning three Michelin stars
content: Dubai’s Trèsind Studio, led by Chef Himanshu Saini, is the first Indian restaurant to win three Michelin stars. The menu? An ode to India’s four corners

title: EC launches probe into complaint against Bengal BJP chief’s wife for holding two voter IDs

title: Rijiju seeks report from I&B Ministry on Arunachal film institute strike

content: The top court was hearing a matter over the death of a 22-year-old student studying in IIT, Kharagpur, on May 4.

title: India may let U.S., foreign firms bid for government contracts: sources
content: The government is likely to allow U.S. firms to bid for contracts worth over $50 billion, mainly from federal entities, as it negotiates a trade deal with Washington

title: Operation Sindoor showed terror in India fully sponsored by Pakistan: Amit Shah
content: “We targeted the terrorists, but Pakistan took it on itself and proved that it was Pakistan sponsored terrorism.”

title: Madras High Court sentences senior IAS officer to one-month simple imprisonment in contempt case

title: Former NCP leader from Pune, son arrested in dowry harassment, abetment of suicide cases
content: Rajendra Hagawane’s daughter-in-law Vaishnavi allegedly ended her life on May 16, 2025, at her in-laws’ house in the Bavdhan area of Pimpri-Chinchwad in Pune district

title: Tamannaah Bhatia as face of Mysore Sandal: Activists protest appointment of ‘non-Kannada’ actor
content: While protestors demanded that the deal be cancelled, Minister for Commerce & Industries M.B. Patil defended the choice as a research-backed decision in view of business.

title: Drug menace is Punjab’s biggest challenge, says Punjab Governor Kataria
content: Even as Punjab’s AAP government asserts that the State is on the verge of becoming ‘drug-free’, Mr. Kataria believes it’s a long way to go before achieving success in complete drug eradication

title: AECS Maaruti College of Dental Sciences & Research Centre in Bengaluru closed, students in limbo
content: Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and the DCI had issued an order on March 6 withdrawing recognition to the college and suspended admissions for BDS and MDS courses for the year 2025-26

title: Rahul Gandhi to visit Poonch on May 24 to meet families bereaved during shelling by Pakistan
content: This will be the second visit of Rahul Gandhi to Jammu and Kashmir after the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack in which 25 tourists and one local were killed

title: Kerala BJP leader seeks NIA probe against rapper Vedan for ‘disparaging’ PM Modi in his songs
content: CPI (M) says NIA complaint against Mr Vedan emblamatic of the BJP’s intolerance to dissent and opposition to the RSS’s revanchist Hindu majoritarian ideology, rooted deeply in the socially abhorrent and outlawed caste system.

title: India’s ‘Akashteer’ system shines in Operation Sindoor, DRDO chief foresees international demand
content: The fully automated ‘Akashteer’ system enables detection, tracking, and engagement of enemy aircraft, drones, and missiles by integrating various radar systems, sensors, and communication technologies into a single, mobile, vehicle-based framework, making it easier to handle in hostile environments.

title: Andaman airspace closed for three hours for high altitude weapon test
content: ‘This is a routine practice here in Andaman and Nicobar Islands as we have done similar tests in the past also,’ said a senior defence official.

title: Piyush Goyal meets U.S. Commerce Secretary in Washington to discuss proposed trade pact
content: In a bid to advance trade talks, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal met U.S. Secretary Howard Lutnick in Washington for the second time this week

title: Charging sessions go up at public EV charging stations in Karnataka as number of EV users increases
content: According to the data available on Vahan dashboard, 19,284 new EVs were registered across Karnataka from January 2025 till date

title: Supreme Court directs Centre, IAF not to release officer part of Operation Sindoor from service
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and N. Kotiswar Singh sought responses from the Centre and the IAF on the plea of Wing Commander Nikita Pandey who claimed discrimination for being denied permanent commission

title: Punjab Vigilance Bureau conducts raid at AAP MLA Raman Arora's house
content: Sources said raids in AAP MLA Raman Arora’s house followed over allegatons of issuing false notices to innocent people

title: IAF, Lahore ATC denied IndiGo permission to use Pakistan airspace: DGCA
content: Defence sources deny DGCA claim, say the IAF is not the approval authority to provide Indian aircraft permission to enter international airspace

content: In a media release issued early on May 23, BMRCL announced that trains had not been operating from Whitefield (Kadugodi) station since 5 a.m. because of a glitch

title: IMD issues red alert for Raigad, Ratnagiri and orange alert for Mumbai, ghats
content: The IMD has issued an orange alert for Mumbai for May 23 and 24, warning of heavy to very heavy rainfall accompanied by thunderstorms and gusty winds reaching speeds of 50 to 60 kilometres per hour at isolated places.

title: Greater women participation in judiciary will improve quality: Supreme Court
content: The apex court said advancing women’s greater participation in judiciary would greatly benefit from a judicial force that is competent, committed and most importantly, diverse.

title: ChipIN Centre drives lakhs of hours of circuit design training by students at top institutes: MeitY data
content: The tools are a “vital step towards generating industry-ready manpower and a self-reliant chip design ecosystem in India,” an expert told The Hindu

title: Government forms special NIA court in Manipur for trial of cases related to ethnic violence
content: The NIA has taken over three key cases related to ethnic violence that began on May 3, 2023; these cases include the abduction and killing of six women and children in Jiribam, as well as other violent incidents.

title: Elephant tramples woman to death in Belur
content: There have been a series of deaths in elephant attacks in Belur and Sakleshpur taluks of Hassan district since January this year

title: Maoist killed in encounter with security personnel in Chhattisgarh’s Sukma
content: The gunfight between the Moists and the security forces broke out on (May 2) evening in a forest under the jurisdiction of Kistaram police station area

title: 48-hour bandh affects normal life in Manipur's Imphal valley
content: All business establishments, educational institutions, government and private offices remained closed and public transport remained off the roads

title: Narco-terrorism case: SIA conducts raid in Jammu & Kashmir’s Poonch
content: According to sources, the raid on house of Zameer Sheikh was linked to an investigation into a narco-terrorism funding case

title: IMD declares yellow rainfall alert for 12 districts in Kerala
content: The Indian National Centre for Ocean Information (INCOIS) has issued a special alert for Kerala’s coastal districts; predicts waves reaching a height of up to 3.2 metres in Kozhikode and Kannur coastal localities

title: NALCO records highest ever profit at ₹5325 crore
content: The Navaratna central public sector enterprise is ready with plan for the 5th stream expansion of the alumina refinery, the operationalization of the Potangi Bauxite Mines, and expansion of the existing smelter plant and captive power plant

title: Odisha CM Mohan Charan Majhi lays foundation stone for projects worth ₹1.15 lakh crore in Kalinga Nagar
content: Tata Steel’s 5 MTPA Integrated Steel Plant (ISP) expansion at an estimated investment of Rs 47,599 crore was inaugurated

title: May 13 Airtel network disruption in T.N., Kerala highlights pitfalls of telecom growth
content: Earlier this month, Airtel users lost access to phone calls for several hours across all of Tamil Nadu and Kerala, the largest such disruption in recent times.

title: Kerala HC issues directive to family courts on parents’ custody of children
content: Do not make police stations a place for exchanging children for custody between the separated mother and father

title: Standing ovation for Satyajit Ray’s restored film in Cannes spreads joy in Bengal
content: The film, based on a story by the celebrated Bengali writer Sunil Gangopadhyay, is about four Calcutta friends taking an unplanned break to the forests.

title: Multi-party delegation arrives in Moscow, to meet members of Russian Duma and Foreign Ministry
content: On May 24, they are scheduled to address a press conference and interact with the local media before leaving for Slovenia.

title: Kalaburagi cherishes the enduring legacy of Banda Nawaz
content: The final resting place of Hazrath Khwaja Banda Nawaz Gesu Daraaz in Kalaburagi has devotees cutting across religious boundaries visiting

title: Akshara Brahma: Where every word is a prayer for A.P.’s Savara tribals
content: In the valleys of the Eastern Ghats, a quiet social revolution is afoot. Hundreds of Savaras, a particularly vulnerable group of tribespeople renowned for their art and dance, are adopting a unique religious order that views their language as divine. In ‘Akshara Brahma’, the community sees a vehicle to ensure the continuity of its culture and uplift people, finds T Appala Naidu

title: Saraswati Pushkaralu in Kaleshwaram: when rivers meet and faith overflows
content: With the once-in-12-years Saraswati Pushkaralu under way, the town of Kaleshwaram has transformed into a sacred theatre of ritual and riverine power. At this rare confluence of three rivers — Godavari, Pranahita and the invisible Saraswati — pilgrims gather to seek spiritual liberation, guided by myths and the deep pull of something unseen yet powerfully felt, writes P. Sridhar

title: BJP W.B. State president Sukanta Majumdar’s wife named in two voter lists, complaint filed at election commission
content: This development comes as the ruling Trinamool Congress leaders have accused BJP of trying to include duplicate and fake voters in Bengal’s voter lists

title: India welcomes U.K.'s decision to hand over sovereignty of Chagos Islands to Mauritius
content: In its reaction, India said it has consistently supported Mauritius's "legitimate claim" over the Chagos Archipelago in keeping with its principled position on "decolonisation, respect for sovereignty, and the territorial integrity of nations".

title: Bengaluru under water yet again
content: Boats and tractors were pressed into service to rescue people as pre-monsoon showers battered the city and left many layouts and roads flooded. K.V. Aditya Bharadwaj and Shreyas H.S. examine the systemic problems that have pushed the city into such situations repeatedly

title: School timings changed in Kashmir amid heatwave conditions
content: According to an order issued by Directorate of School Education Kashmir, the new timing in schools within the municipal limits of Srinagar city will be from 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m., while in the areas falling outside the municipal limits, the timing will be from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.

title: ‘Bengal actively transitioning to renewable energy, seeks private sector participation’
content: This comes amidst a nationwide push for a transition to clean energy sources, with a target of achieving 500 gigawatts (GW) of energy from non-fossil sources by 2030

title: Sanjay Raut alleges attempt to bribe State Legislature’s panel during Dhule visit, CM orders SIT probe
content: Mr. Raut called for a thorough probe into the matter to investigate the person under whose name room 102 was booked

title: Keshav lashes out at Jagan for his remarks on NDA govt.
content: They are aimed at stalling development of the State and Amaravati, and terrorise industrialists, says the Finance Minister

title: No deadline to apply for ration cards, says Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: Cards are being issued in 21 days of submission of application, subject to compliance with the eKYC norm, he says

title: Suvendu Adhikari targets WB Government over OBC reservation
content: In May 2024, the Calcutta High Court cancelled all Other Backward Classes (OBC) certificates issued in West Bengal since 2010

title: Awami League supporters stare at an uncertain future under the interim government
content: Individuals previously aligned with the Awami League are increasingly being subjected to mob attacks and legal persecution under the Yunus-led interim government; at least 119 people have been killed and 74 injured since the interim government assumed office in August, says Human Rights Support Society

title: Naidu insists on scientific crop planning that aligns with global and domestic market trends
content: Cultivation must be restricted to crops with strong market demand, he says, adding that short-term and long-term challenges need to be addressed through the Cabinet Sub-Committee

title: Moon, Mars And Beyond: India, Europe Enter New Era Of Space Cooperation
content: Even as Indian and European space agencies continue to prepare astronauts since a year for the Axiom-4 mission to the ISS, the two are forging new frontiers in space cooperation.

title: "Linguistic Mistake": Madhya Pradesh Minister's Fresh Apology Over Colonel Remark
content: Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah on Friday issued a fresh apology for his objectionable remarks on Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, calling it a "linguistic mistake", and said he did not intend to offend any religious community.

title: Harvard University's 'Links' To China, Iran Triggers US National Security Concerns
content: As the US government's crackdown on Harvard University intensifies, links to China and Iran have emerged, raising national security concerns in the United States.

title: Hindu Wedding Disrupted Due To Rain, A Muslim Marriage Venue Comes To Rescue
content: In a remarkable display of interfaith harmony, a Muslim family came to the help of a Hindu family which was at sea after heavy rains disrupted their marriage rituals.

title: "Not India, Anyplace Else": Trump Warns Of 25% Tariff On Non-US-Made iPhones
content: US President Donald Trump said on Friday Apple will have to pay a 25% tariff if phones sold in the country are not made within its borders.

title: Russian Spy Agency Might Have Planted Brazilian Birth Records 30 Years Ago
content: The Russian agents held what appeared to be legitimate Brazilian birth certificates, not counterfeits, not recently inserted, but real entries in decades-old civil registries.

title: "What Was That Bang": When OceanGate CEO's Wife Heard Titan Implosion
content: Wendy Rush, the wife of OceanGate CEO Stockton Rush, knew exactly when the Titan submersible carrying her husband and four others imploded.

title: Man Who Uploaded Photos Of Women In Bengaluru Metro On Instagram Arrested
content: The individual who was allegedly behind the Instagram handle which shared photographs of women commuters on the Bengaluru metro network has been taken into custody.

title: 121 Illegal Bangladeshi Nationals Detained In Delhi, To Be Deported
content: As part of an ongoing crackdown on illegal immigration, the Delhi Police have detained 121 Bangladeshi nationals from Outer North Delhi for residing in the country without valid documentation.

title: Man Resting Under Tree Dies After Civic Workers Dump Sludge On Him
content: In a case of negligence, a 45-year-old vegetable seller died after workers allegedly belonging to the Bareilly municipal corporation, in Uttar Pradesh, dumped a trolley of sludge on him.

title: Only 32% Of Job Seekers Consider Themselves Prepared For Interviews: Report
content: A large number of job seekers attend interviews without preparation and fail to unlock their true potential, said a report on Friday.

title: Hay Fever: Why Symptoms Are So Bad This Year And What To Do About It
content: Hay fever can be annoying at the best of times. But this year, many people are reporting their usual symptoms are worse than ever before  with their normal go-to remedies doing little to provide relief.

title: Trump Says Major Prisoners Swap "Completed" Between Russia-Ukraine
content: Russia and Ukraine began a major prisoner swap on Friday that was agreed on at their first direct talks in more than three years, a Ukrainian military source said on Friday.

title: No Free Gravy With Parotta And Beef Fry: Court Relief For Kerala Restaurant
content: A restaurant owner in Kerala's Kochi heaved a sigh of relief as a local consumer court near here ruled that gravy need not be given for free to customers.

title: Astronomers Spot Galaxy Shaped Like Milky Way But Is Far More Massive
content: Astronomers have observed a galaxy dating to an earlier epoch in the universe's history that surprisingly is shaped much like our Milky Way but far more massive, offering new insight into galactic formation.

title: Opinion: Opinion | So, Why Has Apple Stuck To Its Chennai Plan Despite Trump's 'Warning'?
content: Tim Cook is more likely bothered about what they think of the way he manages his company's huge cash pile - estimated at well over $300 billion - than an oddball statement from Trump about moving all production to America.

title: Adani Group To Invest Rs 1 Lakh Crore In Northeast Over 10 Years
content: The Adani Group has announced a significant additional investment of Rs 50,000 crore - taking the total to Rs 1 Lakh crore - across the Northeast over the next 10 years, spanning across many sectors including green energy, roads and highways.

title: Elon Musk's DOGE Expands Grok AI In US Government, Raise Conflict Concerns
content: Billionaire Elon Musk's DOGE team is expanding use of his artificial intelligence chatbot Grok in the US federal government to analyze data potentially violating conflict-of-interest laws and putting at risk sensitive information of Americans.

title: 16-Year-Old Boy Stabbed To Death In Delhi After Refusing To Join Teen Group
content: Two teenagers allegedly stabbed a 16-year-old boy to death in broad daylight in north Delhi's Burari area after he refused to join their group, an official said on Friday.

title: Universal Vaccines Could Reshape How We Fight Future Outbreaks
content: Every year, the race begins anew. Scientists scramble to track mutating viruses, pharmaceutical companies reformulate vaccines and public health systems brace for another season of jabs and logistics.

title: 'Tariff of at least ...': Trump deals fresh blow to Apple's 'Make in India' plans
content: Donald Trump has warned Apple about tariffs. He says a 25% tariff will be imposed if iPhones are made outside America. Trump claims he told Tim Cook that iPhones for the US market should be manufactured in the United States not in "India or anyplace else." The remarks come at a time when Apple is aggressively expanding its manufacturing footprint in India.

title: How Jyoti Malhotra became ISI agent Danish's first catch in spy hunt
content: An expelled Pakistan High Commission staffer, identified as an ISI officer, attempted to recruit Indian nationals by targeting visa applicants and their relatives. He aimed to gather sensitive information and promote pro-Pakistan narratives online. This incident follows a pattern of Pakistani intelligence operatives using the high commission for espionage, leading to previous expulsions and staff reductions.

title: 'A water bomb': Pak Senator reveals impact of India suspending Indus pact
content: Pakistani Senator Syed Ali Zafar has urged the government to address the potential water crisis arising from India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty after the Pahalgam attack. He warned of dire consequences for Pakistan's agriculture and population, heavily reliant on the Indus Basin water. India's decision to hold the treaty in abeyance is a response to cross-border terrorism.

title: India targets Pak's terror funding, to approach World Bank & FATF
content: India is intensifying its efforts to financially isolate Pakistan, contesting World Bank loans and urging the FATF to reinstate it on the grey list. This follows India's opposition to the IMF bailout, citing concerns about Pakistan's economic history and potential misuse of funds for terrorism.

title: 'Vajpayee didn't ...': Harivansh counters Rahul Gandhi's Op Sindoor remarks
content: Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh rebuked Rahul Gandhi for questioning the government and armed forces regarding Operation Sindoor, referencing Atal Bihari Vajpayee's conduct during the 1971 war. He highlighted instances of alleged UPA government missteps, including concealing news of soldier beheadings.

title: Everything changed for Elon when Trump denied Tesla CEO access to ..., says MAGA man Steve Bannon
content: Following a New York Times report in March 2025 about a potential Pentagon briefing on U.S.-China conflict, Donald Trump denied Elon Musk's involvement, leading Musk to distance himself from the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Musk shifted his focus back to Tesla, SpaceX, and Twitter, reducing his political donations.

title: 'Tough life': SC asks IAF not to release woman officer who served in Op Sindoor
content: The Supreme Court intervened in the case of Wing Commander Nikita Pandey, directing the government and IAF to halt her release from service. Pandey alleged discrimination in being denied permanent commission despite her exemplary service in Operations Balakot and Sindoor. She claimed that although she ranked second in the country among expert fighter controllers and had served over 13.5 years, she was being discharged due to a 2019 policy change that denied her a permanent commission.

title: 'Talks going nowhere': Trump calls for 50% tariff on EU from June 1
content: Donald Trump plans a 50% tariff on the European Union starting June 1, 2025. He says trade talks are stalled. Trump claims the EU takes advantage of the US. He also warns Apple. Trump wants iPhones sold in America to be made in America. He says tariffs will apply if Apple manufactures elsewhere.

title: BJP, Congress locked in war of words after Rahul's Op Sindoor remarks
content: Rahul Gandhi's criticism of India's foreign policy under Modi sparked a political row, questioning India's global standing post Operation Sindoor. BJP retaliated, accusing Gandhi of undermining the nation and armed forces. The MEA refuted Gandhi's claim about warning Pakistan before the operation, clarifying it was during the early phase. Operation Sindoor was launched in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Microsoft software engineer fired for disrupting CEO's speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: India legend makes massive statement on Rohit, Virat Kohli retirement
content: Dilip Vengsarkar expressed surprise at Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Test retirements, expecting them after the England tour. He acknowledged their significant contribution and the void they leave. Vengsarkar highlighted the opportunity for domestic players to step up and praised Shreyas Iyer's consistent performance across formats, deferring to selectors on replacements.

title: NSA Doval to visit Russia next week: What is on agenda
content: NSA Ajit Doval is scheduled to visit Moscow to push for the swift delivery of remaining S-400 systems, potentially ordering more to enhance India's defence capabilities. This visit follows parliamentary delegation's trip and India's Operation Sindoor, which highlighted the effectiveness of Russian-origin defence platforms. India seeks deeper strategic coordination with Russia against terrorism and expects continued support.

title: JEE Main result declared for Paper 2: Download scorecards here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced the JEE Main 2025 Paper 2 results for B.Arch and B.Planning on May 23 at jeemain.nta.nic.in. Candidates can access their scorecards using their registration number and date of birth. The scorecard contains subject-wise marks, overall NTA score, AIR, and personal details necessary for further admission processes.

title: Last offline villages in world where 2.6 billion still wait for internet
content: Despite technological advancements, 2.6 billion people globally remain offline due to geographical isolation, political instability, and economic marginalization. This digital divide impacts access to education, healthcare, and economic opportunities, particularly in remote regions like the Himalayas and parts of Africa. While satellite solutions like Starlink offer potential, high costs and infrastructure challenges hinder widespread adoption, leaving many communities disconnected.

title: 'Vaibhav Suryavanshi will play for India in 2 years'
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old batting prodigy, impressed in the IPL 2025 with Rajasthan Royals, scoring 252 runs in seven innings, including a blazing century. His coach, Ashok Kumar, believes that if Suryavanshi focuses on fitness and fielding, he could be fast-tracked into India's senior T20I team within two years. Ashok Kumar, who coached Suryavanshi at the Bihar U19 and senior men’s teams, believes the youngster has what it takes to be fast-tracked into the senior T20I setup within two years — provided he focuses on fitness and fielding.

title: Turbulence & a no from Pak: What IndiGo pilots faced before landing in Srinagar
content: An IndiGo flight from Delhi to Srinagar faced severe turbulence and a hailstorm. The pilots navigated challenging conditions after encountering bad weather near Pathankot. They were denied permission to deviate from their course. The crew manually flew the aircraft after autopilot disengaged. The plane landed safely in Srinagar with a damaged nose cone.

title: 'Cheap publicity': SC imposes fine for plea linked to CJI protocol breach
content: The Supreme Court penalized a petitioner for filing a PIL about a protocol breach during Chief Justice of India BR Gavai's Maharashtra visit. The court deemed it a publicity stunt. The issue arose from the absence of top officials at an event honoring Justice Gavai. He had dismissed the matter after officials apologized.

title: SC on student suicides: 'Why are they dying only in Kota?'
content: The Supreme Court has expressed serious concerns over the increasing number of student suicides in Kota's coaching centers, questioning the Rajasthan government's response. "What are you doing as a state? Why are these children dying by suicide and only in Kota? Have you not given a thought as a state?” Justice Pardiwala asked the Rajasthan government.

title: 72 hours, 6 conditions: What foreign students at Harvard must do to stay
content: In a significant move, the Trump administration has revoked Harvard University's SEVP certification, jeopardizing the status of thousands of international students, including a substantial number from India. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem issued a warning to universities, demanding Harvard meet six stringent conditions within 72 hours to reinstate its enrollment privileges for foreign students.

title: Cars, music, victory sign: Released on bail, gang-rape accused given hero’s welcome
content: Outrage is brewing in Karnataka's Haveri district after seven men, accused in a gang-rape case from January 2024, celebrated their release on bail with a public victory procession. The celebration followed the court granting bail due to the survivor's inability to identify the accused during a recent hearing.

title: Gujarat-native store clerk shot dead in Tennessee robbery
content: Dingucha village mourns again as Paresh Patel, a native, was fatally shot during a robbery at a Tennessee gas station. This incident follows the tragic loss of a family from the same village who froze to death while illegally crossing into the US in 2022.

title: Kabir Bedi opens up on getting married four times, says he's never had a one night stand
content: Kabir Bedi, who has been married four times, openly discussed his relationships, emphasizing his emotional investment in each. He clarified that he never engaged in one-night stands, highlighting the long-term nature of his marriages and relationships. Bedi proudly maintains friendships with all his ex-wives, reflecting the positive connections he fostered throughout his life.

title: 'Met targets': IMF defends $1bn bailout package to Pak despite India's pushback
content: Despite India's concerns over Pakistan's support for terrorism, the IMF has disbursed a $1 billion bailout package, stating Pakistan met all required targets under the Extended Fund Facility. The decision followed a review where the IMF board determined Pakistan had made progress on reforms.

title: JEE Advanced result expected soon: Check how to access scorecards here
content: The JEE Advanced 2025 result is expected to be released soon by IIT Kanpur on the official website, jeeadv.ac.in. Response sheets were issued on May 22, followed by the provisional answer key on May 26. The final result is scheduled for June 2. Qualified candidates will proceed to JoSAA counselling for admission to top engineering institutes.

title: Four Maoists killed in encounter along Maharashtra-Chhattisgarh border
content: In a significant blow to Maoist insurgency, four Maoists were killed in an encounter with police along the Maharashtra-Chhattisgarh border in Gadchiroli. This operation follows the elimination of top Maoist leader Basavaraju and 26 guerrillas in Chhattisgarh. Government sources suggest that with Basavaraju's death, the end of red terror, targeted by March 2026, may come sooner.

title: Dalit groom 'pulled off chariot over DJ music' in Mathura
content: In Mathura's Bhureka village, a Dalit groom was allegedly pulled from his chariot and wedding guests assaulted by upper-caste men angered by DJ music and a 'rath' during the procession. The accused also issued death threats, prompting police intervention after the initial disruption and a subsequent return of the mob.

title: Gambhir breaks silence on Rohit, Virat retirement: 'No one has the right ...'
content: Gautam Gambhir has addressed Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Test retirements, terming them personal decisions deserving respect. Speaking before the England tour starting June 20, Gambhir acknowledged the void but highlighted the chance for younger players to step up. He referenced India's Champions Trophy win without Bumrah, emphasising the team's ability to succeed despite senior players' absence.

title: 'Stuffed mouth with cloth, beaten': 13-year-old girl raped by cousin in Ghaziabad
content: In Ghaziabad, a 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her 19-year-old cousin. The accused, who had asked the girl to help with cooking after his wife's death, stayed overnight at her residence and allegedly assaulted her in her room. He threatened her into silence. The assault was discovered when the girl complained of stomach pain.

title: Maharashtra MBBS student drugged, raped by 2 classmates, pal
content: Kolhapur police arrested three men for allegedly gang-raping a 22-year-old MBBS student in Sangli after drugging her drink. The incident occurred in a rented apartment, with two of the accused being her classmates. The survivor reported the crime after confiding in her parents, leading to the arrest and subsequent court remand of the accused.

title: India’s crackdown! Export houses under scanner for illicit Pak trade via UAE
content: Indian authorities are investigating around 20 export houses suspected of laundering money to Pakistan via the UAE. The Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) is scrutinizing dubious transactions involving inflated prices for goods like jewellery and electrical components

title: Support to Pak costs Turkey! Indians shift out weddings
content: Amidst rising tensions stemming from perceived support for Pakistan, wealthy Indian families and NRIs are increasingly avoiding Turkey and Azerbaijan for weddings and corporate events. This shift has led to the rescheduling or relocation of several high-profile events, impacting the region's event industry. Destinations like the UAE, Rajasthan, and particularly Bahrain, are gaining popularity as alternatives.

title: Amit Shah says Modi government marked turning point with Operation Sindoor
content: Amit Shah asserted a change in India's security approach. He mentioned past provocations from Pakistan. Previous governments did not give appropriate responses. Post 2014, India retaliated strongly after attacks like Uri and Pulwama. Surgical strikes and airstrikes targeted terror infrastructure. Shah highlighted Operation Sindoor as a response to the Pahalgam attack.

title: Closing the gates: Harvard University caught in crosshairs
content: Harvard University faces a ban on admitting international students for the 2025-26 academic year as the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) revokes its SEVP certification. DHS alleges non-cooperation with inquiries, a hostile environment for Jewish students, support for pro-Hamas sentiments, and discriminatory diversity policies.

title: ‘Battery ok, engineers not’: Bengaluru CEO’s 'IP67' quip over flooded car goes viral
content: Heavy rain caused widespread waterlogging in Bengaluru. Traffic was disrupted and commuters were stranded. A local entrepreneur's car was submerged. The city's drainage network struggled. RR Nagar zone, however, avoided major flooding due to preventive measures. Officials credited timely drain cleaning and lake management. The incident has renewed debate on sustainable urban planning in Bengaluru.

title: 'Newest member of LSG': Sanjiv Goenka's message
content: Lucknow Super Giants defeated Gujarat Titans by 33 runs, powered by Mitchell Marsh's stunning century. Despite the victory, LSG captain Rishabh Pant acknowledged the team's inconsistency and injury concerns that prevented them from reaching the playoffs. Pant highlighted that the team delivered a complete performance against GT, with Marsh's explosive innings and bowlers dismantling GT's top order.

title: Suicide video, WA chats from man's phone lead to FIR against wife, lover in Mumbai
content: In Mumbai, a woman has been booked for allegedly abetting her husband's suicide following a complaint by his father. The deceased, Siddhesh Ratne, reportedly faced mental harassment and infidelity from his wife, Manasi, and her alleged accomplices, Yuvraj Jadhav and Aarti Shivgan.

title: Mukesh Ambani pledges Rs 75,000cr for North-East; Adani to invest Rs 50,000cr
content: Reliance Industries and Adani Group have pledged substantial investments of Rs 75,000 crore and Rs 50,000 crore respectively, at the Rising Northeast Investors Summit 2025.

title: 1,000+ strong mob kills Royal Bengal tiger as ‘revenge’ in Assam's Golaghat village
content: In a shocking incident in Assam's Golaghat district, over 1,000 villagers killed a Royal Bengal tiger in retaliation for an alleged human death. Armed with weapons, the mob dismembered the animal, taking body parts as souvenirs. This incident, coupled with recent tiger carcass discoveries, raises serious conservation concerns.

title: Rahul Gandhi visits Delhi University unannounced, leaves officials & ABVP fuming
content: Rahul Gandhi's surprise visit to the Delhi University Students' Union (DUSU) office sparked controversy. University officials, including Proctor Rajni Abbi, criticized the unscheduled visit, citing a lack of notification and security cordons. The ABVP-backed student representatives protested, while the DUSU secretary was allegedly barred from entering her office by NSUI students.

title: Muslim family shares wedding hall with Hindu couple as rain disrupts ceremony in Pune
content: In a heartwarming display of interfaith harmony in Pune, a Muslim family extended crucial assistance to a Hindu family whose wedding plans were disrupted by heavy rains. As the Kazi family's 'walima' was underway, they offered their hall to Sanskruti Kawade Patil and Narendra Galande Patil for their 'saptapadi' ritual.

title: Mentally ill man beheads his 2-year-old niece in Tamil Nadu
content: In Emaneswaram village, a 20-year-old man, reportedly suffering from bipolar disorder, tragically beheaded his two-year-old niece. The horrifying incident occurred while the child was playing near her home; the accused then threw her head into a nearby pond. Authorities apprehended the suspect, who is currently in custody and undergoing questioning, while also receiving medical and legal support.

title: FIR in Indore for cartoons on RSS, PM & Lord Shiva
content: Indore police have filed a case against cartoonist Hemant Malviya for allegedly posting offensive cartoons and comments targeting the RSS, Prime Minister Narendra Modi, and Lord Shiva. The charges include promoting religious enmity, outraging religious feelings, intentional insult, and disseminating false information. Malviya also faces charges under the IT Act related to the publication of sexually explicit material.

title: Will Trump's ban on enrolling foreign students in Harvard lead to mass deportation?
content: The Trump administration escalated its conflict with Harvard University by revoking its ability to enroll international students, demanding compliance on issues like pro-Palestinian protests and diversity policies. Thousands of foreign students face potential deportation unless they transfer or a court intervenes. Harvard currently has nearly 6,800 international students, most of them in graduate programs.

title: Ongoing encounter between forces and terrorists enters second day in J&K's Kishtwar
content: An ongoing encounter in Kishtwar's Singhpora area between security forces and terrorists has entered its second day, tragically resulting in the death of an Army soldier. Fierce gunfight continues as additional troops have been deployed to support the operation, aiming to locate and neutralize the terrorists. This follows recent successful operations in Shopian and Tral where six terrorists were killed.

title: Karnataka govt under fire for picking Tamannaah as face of Mysore Sandal
content: Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited (KSDL), known for 'Mysore Sandal' soap, has appointed Bollywood actor Tamannaah Bhatia as its brand ambassador for Rs 6.2 crore, aiming to expand its national market presence. This decision, however, has sparked controversy, with some questioning the choice over local Kannada actresses.

title: 48-hour bandh in Manipur: Businesses, schools, colleges shut over bus name
content: A 48-hour bandh, called by COCOMI, disrupted life in Manipur's Imphal Valley, protesting the removal of the state's name from a government bus. Businesses and transport were halted, with bandh supporters enforcing closures and staging rallies.

title: UPSC Prelims 2025: Master the last 48 hours with this no-nonsense game plan
content: With UPSC Prelims 2025 just 2 days away, expert mentor Shubham Aggarwal offers a precise 48-hour strategy for aspirants. From stepping away from books to mental resets, sleep hacks, and exam hall tactics—this last-minute guide covers everything you need to stay calm, focused, and ready to perform under pressure.

title: Bold prediction! 'Dice favours Virat Kohli’
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru, aiming for a top-two finish for the first time since 2016, will face Sunrisers Hyderabad in Lucknow. Aakash Chopra anticipates a low-scoring affair at the Ekana Cricket Stadium, favoring RCB despite SRH's potential to disrupt the playoff race. Virat Kohli's consistent form bolsters RCB's chances as they seek to regain momentum after a disrupted season.

title: 16 must-watch stars, 8 must-watch matchups
content: the 2025 NCAA softball super regionals is set for the women's college world series in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma . no. 2-seed Oklahoma will host a no. 15-seed Alabama team that looks to spoil the Sooners' five-peat quest with its talented roster . here are the must-watch players on every remaining team .

title: Our softball experts answered big super regionals questions: Sleepers, WCWS predictions
content: the 2025 NCAA softball super regionals officially kicked off Thursday night . no. 12 seed Texas Tech beat no. 5 seed Florida State 3-0 and no. 11 seed Clemson beating no. 6 Texas 7-4 . sleeper teams to WCWS predictions answer the biggest questions .

title: How on earth can Arsenal stop Barcelona in Champions League final?
content: the 24th edition of the UEFA women's champions league awaits its final showdown in Lisbon on Saturday . the previous four meetings in the Champions League are split evenly (two wins for Arsenal in 2012; two wins for Barcelona in 2021) both teams have scored the exact same number of goals across these matches .

title: NL powerhouses: Sizing up 7 games in 14 days between the Dodgers and Mets
content: the defending world series champions play three games this weekend at Citi Field . the team they beat to win the national league pennant last fall play four games at Dodger Stadium starting June 2 . both teams enter back-and-forth battles for first place in their respective divisions .

title: What we like and don't like about the CFP seeding change
content: the college football playoff will move to a straight seeding model in 2025 . the 2025 season starts in less than 100 days . there are still plenty to discuss regarding what the CFP will look like in 2026 and beyond .

title: Game 2 preview: Can Edmonton recover after epic Game 1 collapse?
content: the Dallas Stars beat the Edmonton Oilers 6-3 in the third period . the Oilers are now a -190 favorite to win the series, per ESPN BET . a win for the Stars was a reminder to fans of an eternal Stanley Cup playoff truth .

title: How Jim Irsay prepared his daughters to succeed him as Colts owners
content: Jim Irsay grew up in privilege, with his father amassing a big enough fortune to acquire the Baltimore Colts in 1972 . but his involvement with the franchise did not originate in the boardroom . he often told stories about picking up players' jockstraps while cleaning the locker room .

title: Summing up the offseason for every AFC team: Barnwell's 16 superlatives
content: there are 32 teams that feel great about where their rosters stand . what stood out about how each franchise handled the offseason? what was notable about the choices they did (or did not) make? and what does all that tell us about how they will do in 2025?

title: 👊 Haliburton 'choke' latest in Pacers-Knicks beef
content: the 2025 Eastern Conference finals are a matchup straight out of the 1990s . new york and Indiana have faced off in the postseason eight times . the last time the Knicks were playing for a spot in the Finals was in 2000 .

title: Lokesh to unveil six-pillar vision at TDP’s Kadapa Mahanadu

title: De Bruyne, Sané, Messi, Ronaldo among top free agents in 2025
content: the list of high-profile players whose contracts expire in 2025 is pretty impressive . there are some big names whose futures are not yet resolved . some are working on deals to find a new club behind the scenes . others have agreed their next move before they have even finished playing .

title: Revanth Reddy’s name in ED charge sheet sheds light on his corruption: KTR
content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .
